children.value: Display the current CPU utilization, as a percentage, calculated from
Most Linux kernels provide a virtual
filesystem, providing an interface to various internal data structures.
) includes information on the amount of time (in
) spent in various states. To determine the current level of CPU utilization from this information:
discard the first word of that first line (
sum all of the times found on that first line to get the total time
) by the total time, to get the fraction of time spent being idle
subtract the previous fraction from 1.0 to get the time spent being not idle
multiple by 100 to get a percentage
To get a more real-time utilization, simple repeat the steps above with some small sleep interval in between.
